definition: dowry/to give as a dowry/to accompany sb
to accompany/to keep sb company/to assist/old variant of 賠|赔[pei2]
to deliver/to carry/to give (as a present)/to present (with)/to see off/to send

sentences.english: Always escort a woman back to her seat after dancing with her.
sentences.chinese: 每次舞毕以后，应但陪送女伴回到她的座位去。

sentences.english: We went to Yidu Railway Station accompanied by the woman platoon leader.
sentences.chinese: 女生排长随车陪送我们来到了益都火车站。

sentences.english: I'll be seeing Kate home after the party tonight.
sentences.chinese: 今晚宴会后我将陪送凯特回家。

sentences.english: The young princess was chaperoned wherever she went.
sentences.chinese: 这位年轻的公主无论到什么地方去都由人陪送。

sentences.english: Michael walks Pad Man out of the building safely.
sentences.chinese: 迈可一伙在“将军”的陪送下安全地离开了大厦。

definition: variant of 嫁妝|嫁妆[jia4 zhuang5]
betrothal money (given to the bride's family)
to send the betrothal gifts/(fig.) to conclude a marriage
